CERT.PERSON.NAME: Gina Cloutier
CERT.PERSON.TITLE: Laboratory/Environmental Compliance Supervisor
CERT.LOCATION: Victor Valley Wastewater Reclamation Authority, Victorville, CA
RETURN.TO.SSS: Not Applicable - Spill did not reach a separate storm drainpipe
SPILL.LOC.NAME: Upper Narrows  MH5-1 to MH5-8, City of Victorville
SPILL.LOC.DESC: Spill occured between MH5- 3 & MH5-4 located in the river, and flowed into the Mojave River.
SPILL.CAUSE.EXPLAIN: The interceptor at issue is buried in the river bed and the point of failure is not visible nor accessible for inspection.  A definitive assessment of the cause of failure cannot be determined.  Although no definitive conclusion can be reached regarding the cause, it is possible that heavy rainfall and high river flows caused the river bed to shift and carried heavy debris as significant speed, both of these conditions could have resulted in the damage to the sewer line.
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES: Other (specify below);Inspected sewer using CCTV to determine cause
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES.EXPL: Set up 2 interceptor bypasses and plugged the damaged interceptor to eliminate spill. These bypasses will be ongoing until replacement of the damaged interceptor is completed.  Samples were collected and analyzed each day of the spill.
RESPNS_CORCT_ACTN_TAKEN: Inspected Sewer Using CCTV to Determine Cause;Other (specify below);Plan rehabilitation or replacement of sewer
SSO.CRCTIVE.ACTION.TAKEN.EXPL: Set up 2 interceptor bypasses and plugged the damaged interceptor to eliminate spill. These bypasses will be ongoing until replacement of the damaged interceptor is completed.
SAMPLE.ANALYZE.FOR: Dissolved oxygen;Other chemical indicator(s) - specify below;Biological indicator(s) - specify below;Other (specify below)
SMPLS_ANALYZE_FOR_EXPL: Water quality samples were collected and analyzed for all parameters listed under the current board order for final effluent discharge limitations.
SSO.VOLUME.METHOD: See attached report entitled  Spill Assessment Report in Response to Investigative Order No. R6V-2011-007  for detailed information regarding spill volume estimation.
SSO.OPERATOR.NAME: Gina Cloutier

RETURN.TO.SSS: Not Applicable - Spill did not reach a separate storm drainpipe
SPILL.LOC.NAME: MD22A Upper Pumphouse
SPILL.LOC.DESC: Next to the upper pumphouse in the sprayfield's of Oakhurst WWTF 30 feet of the corner of the building.
WHERE.FAIL.OCCUR.EXP: The 16  Force Main bringing treated effluent from the Oakhurst WWTP to the upper effluent reservoir had a pipeline break. This break occurred down the entire 20 foot section of 16  C905 lineally.  There is no check valves in line with the pond for fire protection purposes, thus draining effluent from the pond.
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES.EXPL: OES was notified upon the discovery of the pipe break. All agencies required came onsite to evaluate what remediation would be required. The spill was investigated and possible cause and effect was evaluated. There was no readable chlorine residual at the point of the spill, the point of entry for the spill entering the fresno river, and no chlorine detectable anywhere. Since the water was treated, it was decided by fish and game environmental scientist, and SWRCB that no cleanup is necessary and is unfeasible. All aquatic life impacted by the spill showed no effect. Fish, frogs, plants and all other native species was thriving.
RESPNS_CORCT_ACTN_TAKEN: Other (specify below);Plan rehabilitation or replacement of sewer;Repaired Facilities or Replaced Defect
SSO.CRCTIVE.ACTION.TAKEN.EXPL: Evaluate current sewer infrastructure to determine if this scenario can happen again, and if it can, how can it be mediated.
SMPLS_ANALYZE_FOR_EXPL: Water was tested for chlorine in multiple locations from the origin of the spill down to miles downstream. The bacteriological samples were ruled to be unnecessary by SWRCB because the river previously was not flowing.
SAMPLE.REPORTED.TO: No water quality samples taken;Not applicable to this spill
SSO.VOLUME.METHOD: The amount of Effluent reservoir capacity last recorded plus the daily flow from the previous reservoir freeboard  reading.
SSO.OPERATOR.NAME: Chad Brown-CPO
Agency: Madera County Public Works Department - Special Districts

CERT.PERSON.NAME: Cari Dale
CERT.PERSON.TITLE: Public Works Manager
SPILL.LOC.NAME: Force main/100 yards NW of Jefferson/Marron
SPILL.LOC.DESC: force main located along embankment of Buena Vista lagoon
SPILL.CAUSE.EXPLAIN: Investigation to the cause is ongoing, preliminary report indicates external corrosion  *recovered volume is estimated to be 80% of the spilled volume, pending more detailed calculations
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-up (mitigated effects of spill);Contained all or portion of spill;Returned all or portion of spill to sanitary sewer system;Other (specify below)
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES.EXPL: City crews and neighboring agencies responded as soon as the spill was known.  Specialty contractor was hired to install sheet piling to isolate the pipe from the lagoon water.  Additional contractor was hired to excavate and complete the pipe repair.  Pumping trucks and vactors were brought in to divert a portion of the flow to a gravity line.  Additional flows were diverted to the City of Oceanside.  Water from the lagoon was pumped back into the wastewater system for treatment.  Aeration and circulation were performed to increase oxygen levels for habitat.
RESPNS_CORCT_ACTN_TAKEN: Adjusted schedule/method of preventive maintenance;Repaired sewer;Other (specify below)
SSO.CRCTIVE.ACTION.TAKEN.EXPL: Additional technologies are being explored to conduct a condition assessment.  Leak detection enhancements are also being explored.
VISUAL.INSPCT.RESULT: Aerial inspection done with Fish and Game staff and City environmental staff.
SAMPLE.REPORTED.TO: County Health Agency;Regional Water Quality Control Board

CERT.PERSON.NAME: Isaiah Hall
CERT.PERSON.TITLE: Collection Division Supervisor
SPILL.LOC.NAME: Running Springs Sewer Interceptor
SPILL.LOC.DESC: Spill is approximately 1/4 mile southwest of Fredalba rd on an easement in Little mill canyon. The sewer interceptor to the treatment plant was located in the canyon and was washed out during the December 22, 2010 storm at approximately 0530 at that time the flows were recorded at the treatment plant at 1200 gpm. We are currently attempting to make the repairs using all staff and outside contractors. Duration of repair unknown as the canyon is severly flooded and attempts to gain acces in the creek are extremely dangerious.
SPILL.CAUSE.EXPLAIN: Flood on 12/22/2010 washed out the canyon the interceptor was located in. Large boulder crushed the concrete blanket and pipe.
WHERE.FAIL.OCCUR.EXP: The failure occured in Little Mill Canyon between manholes 38 and 36. Manhole 37 is severely damaged.
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES.EXPL: We are in the process of replaceing the sewer main. We will have to reroute the main away from the creek. The creek is still severly flooded and inaccesible.
RESPNS_CORCT_ACTN_TAKEN: Other (specify below)
SSO.CRCTIVE.ACTION.TAKEN.EXPL: This entire section of main  including three manholes are being  bypassed and replaced. The flood destroyed approximately 400 feet of main line including three manholes. We are unable to attempt a temp. bypass due to the inaccesability of the line. We are relocating the entire mainline.
VISUAL.INSPCT.RESULT: The creek had visual signs of sewer debris and has been cleaned up. Cleanup took from 12/28/2010 to 1/2/2011
SMPLS_ANALYZE_FOR_EXPL: Samples were taken above, at the site and below. Samples taken were BOD, NFR and BACTERIAL
SMPLS.REPORT.TO.EXPL: Sample results will be submitted to SWRCQB Santa Anna Region

CERT.PERSON.NAME: Maura Bonnarens
CERT.PERSON.TITLE: Manager Wastewater Treatment Division
RETURN.TO.SSS: Not Applicable - Spill did not reach a separate storm drainpipe
SPILL.LOC.NAME: EBMUD Overflow Structures - See Item 11 Description for Details
SPILL.LOC.DESC: Interceptor System Overflowed out of Three Overflow Structures to San Francisco Bay  1) Temescal Creek Overflow Structure, Shellmound Street, Emeryville, CA - 3,239,000 gallons  2) Alice Street Overflow Structure, Alice Street, Oakland, CA - 987,000 gallons  3) Alameda Overflow Structure, Webster Street, Oakland, CA - 627,000 gallons
SPILL.CAUSE.EXPLAIN: All five pumps at the influent pump station at the EBMUD Main Wastewater Treatment Plant (MWWTP) lost control power and did not operate from approximately 2330 on 2017-01-10 to 0130 on 2017-01-11. Extreme weather conditions in the area led to a voltage sag at 2330 in the 115 kV PGE power lines feeding the MWWTP. This created a current surge at the MWWTP and the uninterruptable power supply system (UPS) at the influent pump station switched to the battery backup system for power feed. One of the cells in the backup battery system failed so the UPS switched back to the PGE power, and the current surge in PGE¿s supply lines tripped the breaker for the UPS. This tripped breaker prevented all power from reaching the control systems for the five pumps at the influent pump station. Very high flow rates in the collection system were present at this time which caused the overflow to happen much faster than it would have in normal conditions.
WHERE.FAIL.OCCUR.EXP: The PGE voltage sag led to the failure of the UPS which powers the control system for the five pumps at the Main Wastewater Treatment Plant.
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES: Other (specify below);Restored flow;Other Enforcement Agency Notified
RESPONSE.ACTIVITIES.EXPL: Posted public warning signs  Took water quality samples in affected areas
RESPNS_CORCT_ACTN_TAKEN: Repaired Facilities or Replaced Defect
SSO.CRCTIVE.ACTION.TAKEN.EXPL: The UPS battery bank was disconnected from the UPS, the UPS was put into bypass, and the breaker reset by a qualified Electrician.  The bypassing of the UPS restored control power to the pumps and DCS about 0130 on 2017-01-11.
SURFACE.WATER.IMPACT: Temescal Creek, 250 feet upstream of San Francisco Bay  Oakland Inner Harbor portion of San Francisco Bay
SAMPLE.ANALYZE.FOR: Dissolved oxygen;Other chemical indicator(s) - specify below;Biological indicator(s) - specify below
SMPLS_ANALYZE_FOR_EXPL: Ammonia, Enterococcus, Total Coliform, Fecal Coliform
SAMPLE.REPORTED.TO: County Health Agency;Regional Water Quality Control Board
SSO.VOLUME.METHOD: Interceptor and receiving water levels from instrumentation fed into spreadsheet containing algorithms for determining volume.
SSO.OPERATOR.NAME: Chris Dembiczak
